ObjectMessageDialog Class Reference

#include <ObjectMessageDialog.hpp>

List of all members.

Public Methods

 ObjectMessageDialog (CWidget *parent, RoboticObject &object, const char *message)
 ~ObjectMessageDialog ()

Detailed Description

An object message dialog.

This window displays a dialog message with object information and a user defined message

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: GuiClasses
// Authors: Markus Loffler
// Start Date: Mon May 21 15:18:45 GMT 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: ObjectMessageDialog.t.cpp
// Example program for the class RoboticPlatformWindow.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>
#include <stdio.h>

// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatform.hpp"
#include "StaticObject.hpp"
#include "ObjectMessageDialog.hpp"
#include "QWidgets.hpp"


//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main()
{
  RoboticPlatform::setStartSceneViewerOff();
  RoboticPlatform::init();
  
  StaticObject object;
  ObjectMessageDialog *window =
    new ObjectMessageDialog(0, object, "Please Enable The Arm Power");
  
  int a;
  cin >> a;

  delete window;

  return 0;
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ObjectMessageDialog ( CWidget * parent,
RoboticObject & object,
const char * message )
 

Constructor. Creates a window that displays object information and the message. The constructor returns immediately. The user needs use delete explicitly to remove the window.

Parameters:
parent   The parent widget, set to zero if not available
object   The object for which the message should be displayed
message   The message to be displayed

~ObjectMessageDialog ( )
 

Destructor.
